The detail shown can be attributed to a mosque that was decorated in

choices.label: Safavid Persia, because of its intricately carved stucco capitals that are embossed with gold
Safavid Persia, because of its use of curved multicolored ceramic tiles as surface decoration
Umayyad Spain, because of its combination of classical and Byzantine motifs in ivory inlay carvings
Umayyad Spain, because of its use of mosaic to decorate delicate multilobed arches

unit.text: 7: West and Central Asia, 500 BCE - 1980 CE

topic.text: 7.1: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in West and Central Asian Art

skill.text: Skill 6.B: Justify an attribution of a work of art by explaining similarities with work by a specific artist, culture, art historical style, or object type from the image set.
